name: Vaidyanath

deity.mythology_link: Linked with Ravana's penance in devotional tradition

location.sacred_geography: Major shrine complex in the Deoghar region associated with Shrawani pilgrimage routes
location.access: Connected by road and rail via Deoghar/Baidyanath Dham area

significance.rank: Ninth Jyotirlinga and major destination of the Shravani Kanwar pilgrimage
significance.philosophy: Vaidyanath is revered as Shiva in healing form in devotional practice.

stats.daily_visitors: Varies by season and festival calendar
stats.annual_visitors: Very high annual footfall; peaks during Shrawani period
stats.kanwar_pilgrims: Lakhs of pilgrims during Shravan (varies annually)
stats.unique_feature: A major annual Kanwar Yatra destination associated with Sultanganj-Deoghar routes

description: Baba Baidyanath Dham in Deoghar is revered as one of the twelve Jyotirlingas and a major center of Shravan pilgrimage. District administration sources describe month-long Shrawani pilgrimage routes where devotees carry Ganga water from Sultanganj and offer it at the shrine.
secret_hook: The Deoghar-Sultanganj Kanwar route and month-long Shrawani observances keep this shrine at the center of eastern India's Shiva pilgrimage traditions.
